result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K Dziak was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Brian K Dziak is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Brian K Dziak was found guilty of Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program. 
*  Pay fine of $1000.00  and court costs including all applicable surcharges. Submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) and pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).
* Pay restitution plus surcharges - joint and severally with co defendants.  May not associate with gangs/gang members or gang affiliations or disruptive groups.   May Not have contact with Jill Uttech, John Goik or Kevin Durand their families or their place of employment.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  No association with any indivduals who use or traffic in controlled substance.

records.addlTxt:
Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Brian K Dziak, appeared with Attorney Brenda L VanCuick.  Clerk: PT
Sentencing arguments made.  DE is sentenced to 8 years in the WSP; 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 5 years Extended Supervision.  DE is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program.  No contact with Jill U, John G or Kevin D.  Parties stipulate to restitution in the amount of $880.00 joint and several with co-defendants.   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.   Cash Bond on deposit is to be applied.  Appeal Rights, Firearm Warning & Voting Acknowledgement given.
From D.A. regarding additional discovery.
Request/Order for Presentence Investigation form mailed to def. and Atty VanCuick, as def. left court without the form.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 2 and 3 - Dismissed on State motion.  Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 3/24/16 at 10:30.  Bond continued.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Brian K Dziak, appeared with Attorney Brenda L VanCuick.  Clerk: PT
DNA samples were recently submitted by parties and case is not resolved at this time.  Status conference scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 10:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for March 10, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Special Prosecutor K. Richard Wells appeared for the State. Defendant, Brian K Dziak, appeared with Attorney Brenda L VanCuick.  Clerk: PT
Parties stipulate to State's motion to compel DE to submit to DNA testing and DE is ordered to complete DNA test between 9/29/15 and 10/2/15 at the PSB.  Atty Wells states the previous DNA evidence has not been received back from the Milwaukee Crime Lab yet.  Final Pre-Trial on 11/6/15 at 11:00 AM.

Attorney Margaret Drees appeared for the State. Defendant, Brian K Dziak, appeared with Attorney Brenda L VanCuick.  Clerk: PT
DNA evidence was sent up to Milwaukee and hasn't came back yet so parties mutually request an adjournment.  FPT on 9/23/15 at 10:00 AM.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Brenda VanCuick. Clerk LE.   Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 7-23-15 @ 8:40am with co-defs in 15CF223 and 15CF221. Bond continued.
